request.description: This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to refresh an authentication token.

body.raw:
{
    "title":"New Task",
    "description":"A new task", //optional
    "assignedTo":"a725aaed-b80a-4487-a06f-fe2b4f0568fa", // optional
    "dueDate":"2024-09-23", //YYYY-MM-DD(optional)
    "status":"IN_PROGRESS" //status(optional): IN_PROGRESS, COMPLETED, TODO
}

request.description:
### Create a New Task

This endpoint allows you to create a new task with the provided details.

#### Request Body

- `title` (string, required): The title of the task.
    
- `description` (string, optional): A description of the task.
    
- `assignedTo` (string, optional): The ID of the user to whom the task is assigned.
    
- `dueDate` (string, optional): The due date of the task in the format YYYY-MM-DD.
    
- `status` (string, optional): The status of the task. Possible values are IN_PROGRESS, COMPLETED, TODO.
    

#### Response

The response is a JSON object with the following properties:

- `message` (string): A message related to the response.
    
- `data` (object): An object containing the details of the created task.
    
    - `id` (string): The ID of the task.
        
    - `title` (string): The title of the task.
        
    - `description` (string): The description of the task.
        
    - `dueDate` (string): The due date of the task.
        
    - `status` (string): The status of the task.
        
    - `createdBy` (string): The ID of the user who created the task.
        
    - `assignedTo` (string): The ID of the user to whom the task is assigned.
        
    - `createdAt` (string): The timestamp when the task was created.
        
    - `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp when the task was last updated.
        
- `success` (boolean): Indicates if the request was successful.
    

#### Response JSON Schema

``` json
{
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "message": { "type": "string" },
    "data": {
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "id": { "type": "string" },
        "title": { "type": "string" },
        "description": { "type": ["string", "null"] },
        "dueDate": { "type": ["string", "null"] },
        "status": { "type": "string" },
        "createdBy": { "type": "string" },
        "assignedTo": { "type": ["string", "null"] },
        "createdAt": { "type": "string" },
        "updatedAt": { "type": "string" }
      }
    },
    "success": { "type": "boolean" }
  }
}

 ```

response.body:
{
    "message": "Task Created",
    "data": {
        "id": "59b4053d-f290-4756-a875-e21688a1379b",

        "createdAt": "2024-08-22T20:31:47.970Z",
        "updatedAt": "2024-08-22T20:31:47.970Z"
    },
    "success": true
}

request.description:
This endpoint sends an HTTP DELETE request to the specified task ID to delete the task.

### Response

204 is the success response to this request

### Delete Task Tag

This endpoint is used to delete a specific tag associated with a task.

#### Request

- Method: DELETE
    

#### Response

The response of this request is documented as a JSON schema.
This endpoint sends an HTTP DELETE request to remove all tags associated with a specific task identified by its ID.

This endpoint retrieves comments associated with a specific task identified by its ID.

### Response

The response is a JSON object with the following properties:

- `message` (string): A message related to the response.
    
- `data` (array): An array of objects containing comment details, including:
    
    - `id` (string): The unique identifier for the comment.
        
    - `taskId` (string): The ID of the task associated with the comment.
        
    - `userId` (string): The ID of the user who created the comment.
        
    - `content` (string): The content of the comment.
        
    - `edited` (boolean): Indicates whether the comment has been edited.
        
    - `createdAt` (string): The timestamp when the comment was created.
        
    - `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp when the comment was last updated.
        
- `success` (boolean): Indicates the success status of the request.
    

This response can be documented as a JSON schema for reference.

This endpoint sends an HTTP DELETE request to delete a specific comment identified by its ID.

### Response

The response of this request is a JSON schema representing the structure of the response data. The schema will outline the properties and their data types that can be expected in the response after a successful deletion.

The endpoint retrieves notifications from the server.

### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following properties:

- `message` (string): A message related to the response.
    
- `data` (array): An array of objects, each containing the following properties:
    
    - `id` (string): The unique identifier for the notification.
        
    - `userId` (string): The user ID associated with the notification.
        
    - `taskId` (string): The task ID associated with the notification.
        
    - `message` (string): The content of the notification message.
        
    - `isRead` (boolean): Indicates whether the notification has been read.
        
    - `createdAt` (string): The timestamp indicating when the notification was created.
        
- `success` (boolean): Indicates the success status of the response.
    

#### Example

``` json
{
    "message": "",
    "data": [
        {
            "id": "",
            "userId": "",
            "taskId": "",
            "message": "",
            "isRead": true,
            "createdAt": ""
        }
    ],
    "success": true
}

 ```

request.description:
### Create New User

This endpoint allows Admin to create a new user.

#### Request Body

- email (string, required): The email of the user.
    
- username (string, required): The username of the user.
    
- password (string, required): The password of the user.
    
- role (string, required): The role of the user.
    

#### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following properties:

- message (string): A message related to the request.
    
- data (object): The data related to the request, which may be null.
    
- success (boolean): Indicates if the request was successful.
    

#### JSON Schema

``` json
{
    "type": "object",
    "properties": {
        "message": { "type": "string" },
        "data": { "type": ["object", "null"] },
        "success": { "type": "boolean" }
    }
}

 ```
